content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Extraction System Interface at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter (extraction system) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– A factory burner inserter retrieved at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– A dedicated burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT; its neighbour connection includes an assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– A depot wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the isolated belt depot
– A transport belt segment positioned at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– A dedicated depot burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP (pickup at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at Position(x=3.5, y=13.5))

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
– A boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
– An offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)

### Smelting Facility at approximately Position(x=-3.5, y=20.0)
Consists of:
– A stone furnace at Position(x=-3.0, y=19.0) producing iron plates
– A stone furnace at Position(x=-4.0, y=21.0) producing copper plates

### Research Lab (position unspecified)
Consists of:
– A lab with lab_input {'automation-science-pack': 17} and electrical_id 7106 (status: NO_POWER)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– Errors when connecting transport belts have repeatedly arisen because the target entity is misinterpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine. To resolve this, verify that the target for a belt connection is a proper inserter (or a similar valid entity) rather than a steam engine.

– Errors when placing wooden chests include instances of:
 • The target position being too far from the player. Always move closer to the desired placement location to meet the maximum allowed distance.
 • Missing inventory items (no wooden chest available) and referencing undefined variables (e.g. NameError for target_chest). Ensure the required entity is in inventory and that all variables used for placement are correctly defined before use.
